spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall massing loosely resembles the 2D plan (garage at lower-right; central kitchen zone; living zone on right; bedroom cluster on left), but multiple rooms are repositioned/merged and several circulation/entry spaces are not represented. The master suite is not clearly located at the bottom-left as in plan (a bedroom appears closer to bottom-center). The theatre room location/identity is inconsistent (render shows a generic lounge at bottom-left). Kitchen/pantry geometry is simplified and does not match the plan’s pantry placement. Door locations/orientations are largely not modeled (open wall gaps instead), preventing verification and implying incorrect placements. Window distribution does not match the plan (extra/missing openings and different sizes/locations). Room proportions are noticeably altered (right-side living/dining area enlarged; left-side service/amenity rooms compressed).

structural_fidelity.notes: Several labeled plan spaces are missing or collapsed into generic rooms/voids (alfresco, verandah, portico, pantry detail, linen/robes, WIR/ensuite composition). Adjacencies are partially correct at a macro level (kitchen near living; garage adjacent to entry side), but key relationships are wrong/unclear (master suite vs theatre vs study placement; service core of bath/wc/laundry). Many doors are not embedded (render uses open passages), so true door-wall integration and swing/orientation fidelity is not achieved. Wall thickness appears uniform but simplified; internal partitions do not consistently follow the plan.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture does not reliably map to the plan’s room functions: the theatre is not furnished/identified as a theatre, the activity space is ambiguously furnished, and dining/living furniture appears duplicated/relocated relative to the plan. Scale is generally plausible, but placements imply different room boundaries than the 2D plan.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Render is clean with coherent lighting and readable geometry. However, camera is more top-down perspective than a true isometric, and it does not communicate exterior elements (alfresco/verandah/portico) that are essential to the plan. Visual clarity is good, but architectural correctness is undermined by missing doors and oversimplified openings.

detected_errors.description: Alfresco area shown on the 2D plan (top-right) is missing/not modeled as a distinct outdoor space in the 3D render.
Verandah and portico (bottom edge/entry frontage in the 2D plan) are missing in the 3D render.
Pantry is not represented as a distinct enclosed room with correct placement adjacent to the kitchen as in the 2D plan.
Linen/robe storage elements (e.g., LINEN, multiple ROBE locations, recesses) are largely missing or not modeled as per plan.
Master suite location and composition (master + ensuite + WIR cluster at bottom-left in plan) does not match the 3D render; bedroom appears repositioned and the suite layout is not preserved.
Theatre room (bottom-left in plan) is not clearly placed/defined in the 3D render; shown as a generic lounge with different boundaries.
Study placement near the entry (bottom-center in plan) is inconsistent/unclear in the 3D render (a desk appears in a different left-side room).
Door placement and orientation cannot match the plan because most door leaves/swings are not modeled; openings are used instead, implying incorrect door implementation.

Window placement differs substantially: the 3D render shows a series of high horizontal windows along the top wall and large sliders at the bottom-left that do not correspond to the plan’s specific window/door locations.
Proportion distortion: the right-side living/dining zone appears oversized relative to the plan, while left-side service spaces (bath/wc/laundry) appear compressed/simplified.
Hallucinated/extra generic open spaces and duplicated living/dining furniture groupings appear that do not correspond to distinct labeled rooms in the 2D plan.
